p: Maltodextrin is widely used as an encapsulant in spray-drying because it has high values of solubility in water and high glass transition temperature [ 39]. Higher concentrations (10% > 20% > 30%) of wall material influenced higher solubility of spray-dried powders (sodium caseinate 80.05% > 80.9% > 81.25%, skim milk 95% > 95% > 99.9%, respectively), however using beta-cyclodextrin in the same concentration range solubility decreases (55%, 45%, and 42.5%, respectively).
